page.title: 04 A LOCAL FARMING FAMILY
page.content: Miss Collins,for many years was the school secretary at Sexey's in Bruton,mentioned in another block, but she is also the daughter of a farming family of some local standing. She was born on a farm near Milton Clevedon,called Greenscombe and followed the family into farming by taking over in 1962. She likes the farming life,but not the mechanical side.When she started,there were few chemicals involved,unlike today.She farms on hilly land,which she uses for sheep. She used to keep dairy cattle but now the land is all turned over to grass. There have been no real farming tragedies in her life,except once when an old blind horse died in harness,up on a hill,known afterwards as Breakheart Hill for some time.
